Hi Mark, 

Apologies for the confusion. I have now blocked out the rest of the site. Please have a look and let me know what you think? 

Google will take a few days to register the change.

Hi Heath, unless you still have to do more to the website?? The banner is there and looks good but the site is still operational. Ie I can still search for cruises. The site search engine needs to stop.

Cheers

Mark Knox

Cruiseworld Holidays

Hi Mark, 

Confirming we have added the below message across the top of the site as requested. 

Please have a look and let me know what you think? 

I have also indicated to Google to load this message in the search results. Please note, this is at their discretion as to what they actually load.

Hi Heath, this could be to 'wordy'

Due to Covid19 impact on the world and Cruising Industry. We are temporarily suspending the Cruiseworld Holidays website until further notice. Please call Helloworld Travel Revesby during our business trading hours 02 9772 2066 for any urgent enquiries. Our industry is down but not out and we will be back!

Regards

Mark Knox

Owner

Cruiseworld Holidays

Hi Mark, 

Apologies for my delay. Ok we are all set, we have updated your subscription to downgrade to the $125/mth option. 

Regarding the message about a temporary closure, yes, it would be ideal to add this to the banner across the site. If you would like to supply us the content, we can update this. 

We can also add the same message to your homepages meta data which Google may pickup and show in the search results as well. Let me if you want us to do this also?

Hi Heath, just following up on Tuesdays email I sent you.

Cheers

Mark Knox

Thanks Heath. Yes I did. I need to talk to the remaining 2 staff we have. I suspect neither one wants the job to update the site and closing is the easy option. I also want to talk to some senior people still in Cruiseco and get their thoughts. I'll get back to you shortly.

Cheers

Hi Mark, 

Just checking in to make sure you received the below?

Hi Mark, 

Thanks for this info, sounds like it's been an interesting run and this all makes complete sense in light of the current climate. It's a damn shame!! I can't imagine how it must feel to be at the mercy of something so out of your hands. We felt it like everyone, but nowhere near what you have/are going through. 

Regarding closing the site, it's fairly straight forward. We will take a backup of the site and store it on DropBox and send you a link. You can then download that to your computer and save it for such time that you want to re-launch the site. 

Let me know if you would like to proceed with that option. Bearing in mind that if you do take the site down, all traffic etc. will cease from Google and when you do re-launch, Google will treat you like a new site and you will have to effectively start again. It's not a huge drama, but just want to make sure you are across that. The alternate option could be to go onto a maintenance only plan with us, where we keep the site live and updated (plugins, code etc.). This doesn't include any content updates, but brings the monthly charge of $250 down to half at $125. Just another option if you want to keep the site live. 

Let me know, happy to help out where ever we can.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath, for about 9 years now we have been running the Cruiseworld website. It has been successful for us and the main reason is that we are a 'Cruiseco' agent of which there are only 100 agents in the country. That gave us a niche market to products like music cruises. Helloworld never liked us selling Cruiseco product but couldn't stop us. We were just frowned on by management. In December last year Cruiseco announced that they were selling the business to Helloworld. We are already a Helloworld agency so this is a death nell to our on-line Cruiseworld Holidays business. We now don't have any exclusivity about us. The Helloworld in the next suburb can sell the same product as us.


So, I'm considering collapsing Cruiseworld website for now since cruising is 12 months away as a min and we are now just another on-line cruising site with a retail outlet. So costs like web maintenance(although fair and reasonable) and Google adwords to maintain relevancy i.e page 1 could be removed out of the business which as you would guess is struggling to survive at the moment.


In regards to closing the website…

How easy is this to do?

Can I start it back up again by simply calling your business?

Who holds all the info - storage


Cheers


Mark Knox

0404 055 995
